thread.title: NAB leases flagship site for new age branch
thread.title_full: NAB leases flagship site for new age branch

title: NAB leases flagship site for new age branch
text:
Charter Hall has signed a long term lease with NAB, which will see the bank locate its flagship retail and premium business banking facilities at 333 George Street.
Banks are the new hot tenants NAB has beaten out a plethora of big names including international retailer Marks & Spencer to snare prime space in Sydney's George Street for its flagship "branch of the future".
NAB will be the first tenant in Charter Hall's 333 George Street site, currently under construction, and indicates that banks are the new wave of tenants in prime city locations, once the domain of high profile fashion retailers and restaurants.
As first revealed by BusinessDay, NAB will occupy space across the ground floor and level one of the building and will enjoy direct street access and high visibility to George Street.
Advertisement It is also understood that HSBC is looking at the tenancy next door to NAB.
333 George Street Melissa Reynolds, executive general manager NAB Retail, said the location of NAB's new Sydney CBD branch showcases its commitment to meet customer expectations and demand.
"NAB is focussed on developing deep customer relationships and our 333 George Street location will become a flagship branch for our customers in the Sydney CBD and surrounding areas. We are committed to investing in our branch network to meet the evolving needs of our customers."
"Bank branches are here to stay. The more complex the issue, such as home loans or retirement plans, the more customers ask for direct, personal service.
"It was about empowering the customer to choose what they need and the bank to deliver," she said.
The new branch at 333 George Street, where the format is still being finalised, is expected to offer a range of ATMs that count change, allow direct deposits without cards and interactive internet banking. The bank will also cater for one-on-one contact for more complex businesses or home loans and financial services.
The owner of 333 George Street, Charter Hall's office fund, is developing a $250 million three-level retail and 15-storey office complex in the heart of the city opposite Martin Place. Both areas are set to be revitalised with a pedestrian mall for George Street and a multi-million dollar upgrade of Martin Place.
This follows from the rash of new international tenants coming into the City, with fast fashion and the major telcos, Vodafone and Microsoft, all calling Pitt Street Mall home.
Alex Alamsyah, Knight Frank's senior director of retail and the retail leasing agent for 333 George Street, said Martin Place is once again becoming the financial hub of Sydney as landlords choose the strong covenants that banks offer.
"Major local and international banks, are returning to prime locations in the Sydney CBD, where high rents had previously forced them to make way for global retailers. The decision by NAB to locate their flagship at 333 George Street is a major boost for the revitalisation of Martin Place," Mr Alamsyah said.
'With light rail coming to George Street and increased pedestrian access, the major banks are relocating back into the Martin Place."
Charter Hall's head of development services office and industrial, Andrew Borger said the current development pipeline includes major office projects at 333 George Street, Western Sydney University, Parramatta and the recently announced new Aurizon headquarters in Brisbane's Fortitude Valley.
